benchmark_details.name: HiCBench (Hierarchical Chunking Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: HiCBench is a QA benchmark focused on hierarchical document chunking, designed to effectively evaluate the impact of chunking methods on different components of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the performance of chunking methods and their impact on retrievers and response models within RAG systems.

data.annotation: Manually annotated multi-level document chunking points and synthesized evidence-dense QA pairs.

methodology.calculation: F1 metrics for chunking accuracy, Fact-Cov metric for response quality evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores and Fact-Cov metrics indicate better chunking quality and response quality.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 scores of chunking methods compared across several datasets.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using LongBench, Qasper, GutenQA, and OHRBench datasets.
